scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to infer sensitive customer data, such as income brackets and credit scores, from a deployed customer churn prediction model via a model inversion attack.  The attacker crafts targeted inputs to the model and analyzes the outputs to reconstruct private customer attributes.
initial_goal: Assess the vulnerability of the customer churn prediction model to model inversion attacks.
constraints: input_data_constraints: must use publicly available demographic data
model_access: read-only access to model prediction API
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A large financial institution uses a machine learning model to predict customer churn and proactively offer retention incentives. The model is trained on sensitive customer data, including income, credit score, and transaction history.
